definition: a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]

sentences.english: Deep skin infections were associated with staphylococcal meningitis in infancy.
sentences.chinese: 深部的皮膚感染在嬰兒期易並有葡萄球菌腦膜炎。

sentences.english: Reading can begin with babies and continue throughout the preschool years.
sentences.chinese: 閱讀可以從嬰兒期開始，並繼續貫穿於整個學齡期。

sentences.english: The period from the War of Independence to the Civil War is the babyhood of the United States.
sentences.chinese: 從獨立戰爭到內戰這個時期是美國的嬰兒期。

sentences.english: The science of exoplanet atmospheres is in its infancy.
sentences.chinese: 外星大氣科學的研究還處於嬰兒期。

sentences.english: They may manifest this quality as early as infancy or as late as middle age.
sentences.chinese: 他們可能早在嬰兒期或遲至中年表現出這種品質。

sentences.english: Colorful dreams accompanied me from infancy to the young girls of every day.
sentences.chinese: 多彩的夢想伴隨着我從嬰兒期到青春少女的每一天。

sentences.english: The breast-fed infant will not easily wet the bed.
sentences.chinese: 嬰兒期喝母乳的兒童以後不容易尿牀。

sentences.english: Repair of aortopulmonary window can be performed in neonates and infants with excellent results.
sentences.chinese: 在嬰兒期或新生兒期施行矯正，結果良好。

sentences.english: And at some point in early babyhood, the idea of self starts to form.
sentences.chinese: 在嬰兒期的某一點，關於自我的意識開始萌芽。

sentences.english: The researchers were particularly interested in what happened between babyhood and toddlerhood.
sentences.chinese: 研究人員對嬰兒期和學步的時期特別感興趣。

definition: to help a mother give birth
(abbr. for 嘗試錯誤|尝试错误) trial and error/failure
voice change (at puberty)/to alter one's voice (deliberately)/to sound different (when angry etc)
